title: Printing fails in Tbird and Firefox
content:
I cannot print from Mozilla products, and hae asked the other members of the team that build EndeavourOS, and they are unable to pinpoint the issue either.

Start TBird. Select email, ctrl+P, dialog comes up, choose the Konica, click print, dialog disappears, nothing sent to printer. Repeat process, only this time choose System Dialog link, and this is the dialog I get only Print to File in the dialog box. Same thing occurs in FF trying to print a page.

Versions: OS: EndeavourOS 64-bit, KDE Plasma. ( Current Archlinux ) FF109.0.1 TB102.7.1 CUPS 2.4.2 Thread: https://forum.endeavouros.com/t/thunderbird-printing/36714/24
creator: onyxnz1

title: Thunderbird stopped working and I cannot read any mail from yesterday ( 2/3/2023 )
content:
Hi. I have been trying to solve my problem since yesterday. When I took my PC to fixing store a few years ago, they installed Thunderbird for me. I do not log in password and it is easy to use, I really enjoyed using it. But from yesterday, it stopped working. I had to reset Thunderbird from the beginning. I am poor at PC I checked many web and tried to fix it. But I could not. I called Spectrum customer support tonight to ask for help but they were not nice and I could not get any help.

The problem I have now is I cannot find mobile charter net password. I was able to reset half way I think but after I logged in Spectrum password, it still asked me to log in mobile charter net password. I have never heard about it. I tried to use Spectrum password but it did not work.

Where can I find mobile charter net password? What is it?

I am not native English speaker and I have a hard time to describe my ploblem here. I hope you understand my English and what I am writing here.

Thank you so much for your time.

title: Recieving alias emails from service into local folders no longer working after Thunderbird version upgrade
content:
I finally got around to replacing my old Linux distro which includes an updated Thunderbird client, migrating from 68.10.0 before to 78.13.0 now.

I have five aliases from runbox.com that functioned well with the old Thunderbird client. In Thunderbird 78.13.0, I have added the aliases to my main runbox account setting as identities. The test emails i send are getting through to the runbox server - as evident through the runbox web client, however they are not appearing in Thunderbird.

Since the runbox.com IMAP alias folders did not show up automatically in Thunderbird, I created them manually in Thunderbird. However I noticed a key difference is in the Thunderbird folders I created for the alias.

In the new Thunderbird folder properties, the address reads:

imap://mymainaccount@mail.runbox.com/INBOX/myaliasaccount

whereas before, in the old Thunderbird folder properties, it read:

imap://mymainaccount%40runbox.com@mail.runbox.com/myaliasaccount

I am not able to edit or copy and paste the old functioning address into the new folder properties window to test if this is the root of the problem. Is this something that can be corrected in a profile file manually or perhaps there is something I'm doing wrong procedurally?
creator: john4231

title: How to sort by DATE RECEIVED
content:
Today 2023-02-05 at 14:30, I received a message M on my gmail account: I was able to spot it thanks to my Android gmail app, because Thunderbird on my desktop has a weird way of ordering messages.

These are the headers of the message:

Received: [cut] by mx.google.com with [cut] <[my_email]> [cut]; Sun, 05 Feb 2023 05:20:12 -0800 (PST) [...] Date: Thu, 18 Nov 2021 18:27:06 +0100 Subject: 1

Sent in 2021 (strange but not impossible), received today.

But Thunderbird does not care about the date "received": it simply looks at the date it was sent on. Have a look at the following two screenshots:

gmail shows the message as received today, respecting the headers

For Thunderbird the message was sent and received in 2021.

If I sord by "Order received", then I see this:

Thundebird thinks the message has been received in 2021. However, its number is 119771, showing that it was received after the message number 119768, received and sent today.

This is a mess. Is this a bug or I am doing something wrong?

Using Thunderbird 102.7.1 (64-bit) on Windows 11
creator: lordthistle

title: How to control notifications on Thunderbird for Linux (Pop!_OS)
content:
I'm in the process of moving from MacOS to Linux, in particular the latest LTS version of Pop!_OS. I disliked their default email client intensely, and therefore installed whichever version of Thunderbird was available from their repository. Unfortunately I do not know how to determine the version of either POP!_OS or Thunderbird, so I can't be more precise. My apologies for that. (Where *is* Pop!_OS/Thunderbird's version of Mac's "About ..." menu item anyway?!)

For those unfamiliar with POP!_OS, it's a Ubuntu derivative, and its desktop management is built on gnome 3. Its version numbers also match Ubuntu. Most of the time, instructions for Ubuntu found on the web work for Pop!_OS, at least if they are relatively recent.

I'm being plagued by pop-ups from Thunderbird notifying me of each new email received. I want them gone. Googling for instructions has given me recipes involving menu items that don't appear anywhere in the version of Thunderbird I have. In one case (only) instructions said to look somewhere else on linux; perhaps you export drastically different user interfaces on each operating system?

On the other hand, I don't get a count of unread messages associated with Thunderbird's icon in the Pop!_OS dock, and I do want that. (Is that even possible on linux?)

So two questions in one posting: 1) How can I get rid of pop-up notifications of new email messages? 2) (How) can I get a count of unread emails associated with the dock icon?

Thanks in advance for any assistance, including RTFM links.
creator: DinoNerd

title: Thunderbird 102.7.1 on OSX Monterey cannot connect to Outlook. However, 91.13.1 has no issues
content:
I have two laptops both on Monterey. On my primary laptop I had no issues connecting to our outlook server. However, after I upgraded to 102.7.1, it suddenly stopped working. My logins fail after providing my password. From my other laptop has an older version of Tbird (91.13.1) also running Monterey I am able to connect to Outlook server after providing the password.

Wondering if others have encountered a similar issue.

I am assuming the same is true for servers in Tbird. Can I use a second copy of Tbird somehow, or must I find a third email client? (Windows Mail will not work for this.) Thanks.

content:

title: All of contact list is gone
content:
1. Had Thunderbird on automatic updates (have used it for years.) 2. Used it earlier today, logged back in later and it had reverted to version 9.0.1 and all data was gone as in messages, contacts, etc. 3. Made a copy of the profile file; downloaded & installed version 102.7.1. 4. Brought up the new version--obviously not the version I'd been using as everything is so different (see #1 above, it was set to do automatic updates--???). Messages and filters are back but contacts are missing. 5. Did an import from the profile that I had copied (see #3 above) and restarted Thunderbird. Still no contacts.

Question: How do I get contacts back???

I'd be grateful for help!
creator: bjsantos
